B8MUKzAoMgd_PnNgBFsxBA.text: My Grandpa lives in Safford and the girls at Jerry's take great care of him every morning for his coffee time. During our visit to his house we went to Jerry's with him every morning.  Besides the great memories made, the coffee is great. I ordered the oatmeal with wheat toast and it is consistently good.   Jerry's has a small town feel with great service and good food. What more could you want?

4Vv1wTn4MOddFUQ3hrXqLw.text: This review is for the wait staff only. I'm stuck going to this restaurant as my friends eat here every Friday. When I join them, I watch the guy with the clean shaven head and the cute waitress work hard and hold the whole place together.

0xkEkH3TTvDDkLBjeyyJow.text: Think old style diner, and you get this place.  The atmosphere and decor is kitschy, funky, and interesting, and the food is generally tasty, but in an old style way.  For example, if you order a shake, you get milk and ice cream that isn't all that thoroughly mixed, just like you used to make at home.  It was awesome and nostalgic.  Ultimately, it is as serviceable as any Denny's substitute with better prices and some really outstanding service.  The other reviews on that score surprised me, but we were there later at night, so maybe during the day the staff gets overwhelmed.  All I can say is that the guy who waited on us (whose name I can't remember, but he was a young bald guy) was an outstanding example of customer service.  I wish I could clone him and put him in every restaurant in America.  Go here.  It's not haute cuisine, but you'll enjoy yourself.

jUWCZaSq10HElIMKyNoQow.text: Great breakfast! Been looking all over Phoenix for a taste of home! This is it! (Origally from Illinois) reasonably priced. Good coffee and my waitress was friendly and funny! Definitely will return and make it a habit! Thanks Jerry's!

nBCvintB7DEnPB97aG42pQ.text: After an 8 hour flight from Philly, I could have gone to Venice in that am out of time, and arriving at the hotel nextdoor. Which is very tired and needs a backhoe for its next make over. This place was the highlight. I got there about 11:45, nobody in the place.  I had the fish and chips,$8 about half what I would pay back east. And to my surprise it was very good. Everything was hot and fresh, tarter sauce was very good. Great place for that after hours snack!

HKBcsSF64X0Df-DpXdXAxA.text: Jerrys has good solid food at reasonable prices...Service is decent too. Whatever the hell the assholes are going on about nazis reviews need to be deleted. All this is is a family style resturant.... Get over yourselves,idiots.

Ug-zoL-x-SsvXASXYnCTZw.text: I am often a regular of Jerry's. The staff aways takes are of us and we feel comfortable and happy. Thanks!

aA_qCVxtdfbL_OGVjIbezQ.text: I love that Jerry's is 24hrs and has Wifi.  The wait staff has been very nice and I've enjoyed chatting with them when I was eating there regularly (since my internet was down!).  Not everything is good though, and I've spoken with my friends about what they eat and they seem to agree with me.  I've had good experience with their eggs/breakfast meals.  The scrambles are very good and are worth the price.  I had a sandwich that was ok, not great.  I had a homemade dessert once and was pretty disappointed.  I'll just stick with the breakfast items.  Jerry's is an above-average quality 24hr diner, but some things on the menu are better than others.  Everything is very homemade.

Hbn8Wn1ryc_SloxZ7jRGWA.text: Granted it's a possibility that this restaurant is a mom and pop type of place but they seriously lack in speed of service. Stopped in here for a bite to eat while killing time before an appointment. Walked in and was not even acknowledged. We sat ourselves down and it took about 15 to 20 mins before the server came to ask what we would like to drink. There was a table with four guests that walked in way after we did and had their order taken before we did. It took almost another 20 mins to get our order and once it arrived there was a few things wrong. I ordered the sampler platter which came with onion rings, mozzarella sticks, chicken tenders, and potato bites; my father inlaw ordered the 2 egg breakfast plate which came with hash browns and toast. My onion rings were over cooked, the chicken tenders were over cooked to a point and the mozzarella sticks were slightly over cooked as well. I also ordered a Dr Pepper to drink. My father inlaw ordered a peach tea that tasted more like regular tea with a lemon wedge. His hash browns were under cooked but the eggs came out cooked to my specification. They weren't even busy and they had only two server's that were taking orders. Some lady in a pink shirt was probably a manager but not for sure. I will not recommend this restaurant unless you are willing to wait about an hour for your food. Also my father inlaw had to use the restroom before we left and he told me that the stall was smaller then he can get into with his walker. He is handicapped and had a hard time getting in the stall. My complaint isn't merely about the server's is more towards the restaurant it self. We had to come up from Prescott Valley and where we had to be this place was close by. So I hope someone will do something about there speed of service and customer service could use and upgrade. Thanx

BlVgzHZP9hnjFQUZodpVNg.text: I go here when I want to stuff myself silly on the weekend after a night of drinking. I always order the chicken fried steak and it's VERY good. I am a huge fan of chicken fried steak and eat that anywhere I go and this one is in the top 10. The staff is very friendly but they do seem to be understaffed for the most part but they get the job done. The Cinnamon roll is delicious and HUGE. I have to take it home with me for later because I never have room to eat it while I'm there. You'll most always find this place filled with an older crowd but that's fine, it keeps the noise level down.

uiKhkxNrNCIOSEnvBwe9KQ.text: Wow. Ordered a grilled cheese after a long day of baseball and swimming. Literally a piece of processed cheese between two pieces of bread. Server was really nice but overwhelmed.  Thankfully the meal was pretty cheap.

YlWjc4Rv49YJIVp3PR08nQ.text: I went there with a few friends last week and was very impressed. Service was excellent, even for being in the early hours of the morning. I don't normally care for Denny's or iHOP, but I would definitely come back here. Food was great, loved the hash browns I had. I don't remember our server's name, but he was very good, and had a nice sense of humor too. Thanks!

RWkMBXykKcRedtawUSl2mQ.text: We loved coming here because they are open 24 hrs and the prices were great. In the last three months the service has been absolutely horrible! Linda is the only one who has her customer service together. Unfortunately she only works certain days. Service is bad! Bad! BAD!!! They are such joys of sunshine, I feel like they'd prefer that we didn't come here, like we are burdening them. I'll gladly go somewhere else if y'all are going to have such crap attitudes. Id like to add that our waitress was not pleasant. When it came time to pay the bill, I gave her cash. I put my hand out and she quickly put the money on the counter and walked away. That is a big No No for me. I've worked 16years in the customer service industry. You do not do that. We just left the restaurant. Literally, 10/2/15 10:57am. The manager wasn't in, I will be speaking to her today. I do not want anyone to lose their job, but a definite attitude adjustment is in order.

rmUEWU9OzkjrvdroQlTUiA.text: Great food at a great price!! Food portions were good, service was quick and friendly. The menu had a lot of choices and the atmosphere was that of a diner. Will be back soon for sure!

PHR6ttcDivEyjo1gOYKjIQ.text: My brother and I are from the east coast and we were in Phoenix for the MLB all star game a few years ago, and we still talk about Jerry's and how good it was today. We were staying at the Embassy Suites next door so we walked over to Jerry's to try out something they don't have back home. I personally don't care for breakfast food, but my brother loves it. Those pancakes...delicious delicious delicious. The prices are sooo consumer friendly too, we left like a fifty percent tip and still had enough money to come back the next day and do it again without a care. I have been all over the country and this is the only Jerry's I've ever seen, so if you're in the area I recommend hitting it up, even if you're like me and don't typically like breakfast food. Definitely a local delight.

8CeRV_gWLImF02RJEbLU0g.text: I've been here 4-5 times. Usually for breakfast food but I got the smash burger once.   The pancakes are dense. But their home fries are delicious.   But the other review was not kidding about incompetent cooks. I went in this place at about 2am and the cook was in the parking lot smoking a cigarette. After I placed my order, she came back in and I had a bad feeling. I waited for my food which was supposed to be eggs benedict, and when it came out, the eggs were not poached, they were fried. And they were raw. Not a little underdone, I mean the entire center portion of the white around the yolk was still clear. Cook must have been on drugs. I feel bad for the late night waitress. She offered to have it remade but I said I lost my appetite and asked for the check. I had a cranberry juice. And she said it was on the house, so I walked out.   It took like a year, but I've actually gone back here since that incident and nothing as bad has happened. But bottom line, you're probably better off going to IHOP or Denny's.

oVzhaRUaV64woAjvt0hwLQ.text: The food is good and the staff is friendly.  Only issue being they are a tad slow at times, and after reading other reviews I see some similar issues. But that doesn't take away from the great diner atmosphere.

on8XDl07L5h9RyAo9W2I6g.text: Ah, the gut bomb.  What better way to repair the damage done after a hard night of partying than country gravy?  Jerry's has become my go to spot for post party breakfast.  The restaurant is clean and the service is usually quick.  Imagine the Denny's menu, only with good food.  That's what you get at Jerry's.  Simple, tasty food.  There are a ton of breakfast choices to be had, as well as the lunch/dinner type items.    For me it's all about the chicken fried steak.  The steak is perfectly cooked and the gravy is delicious.  Though my stomach won't thank me for ordering it my taste buds will!  In the realm of 24 hour diners that host neo-nazi book signings, Jerry's has to be top.  (note:  That nazi thing isn't cool)

HQXcvSwgKdzz-UVGf89XTw.text: What IHOP should be. Good pancakes. Skip the biscuits and gravy, though. Update after subsequent visits: Their Californian burger hits the spot as well.

M5KzmQlaDuOByfzF4CCQqA.text: This is place is real good. Went after a night of drinks while being in arizona for the weekend. I orderd the country fried steak. It was a big portio . Very tasty. Good priced also

Sq0zW1RFhYdc07f8JnIRMw.text: We went here tonight and will not be returning.  We waited 30 (more like 40) minutes before our food was delivered and it was wrong.  I ordered French Toast and was given French Dip.  It would normally not bother me and I could have ordered the correct item again but it took 30 minutes to get it this time around who wants to sit and watch someone eat and have them wait another 30 minutes for me to even get my food?  Then they seemed inconvenienced that I wouldn't eat the incorrect food they brought.  We left and went somewhere else, ordered the same thing and had our food eaten and were out of there in the time it took us to just get the wrong food here.

uuuG-Jy8ugcvBslrinJAAQ.text: Good diner Breakfast. Staff were Cheerful, helpful and we felt did a great job. We had breakfast and everything was good.

C82iBS-6Ib9OPYiMuUQAIw.text: Great service and a charming retro atmosphere. Excellent breakfast at a reasonable price.

bC8FvbEHmjBkCxjJQZthTQ.text: Classic Americana! Food was tasty and service was prompt. Hits the spot when you have that old time diner feeling.

5U7P_jK17SyFpRxhpe1tQA.text: Will never go to this restaurant again. I called the day manager sometime ago and spoke to him regarding a younger male waiter working the graveyard shift that was filthy dirty (clothes, nails, hair), tried to pass the buck, typical manager seemed to care less. Recently decided to go back, nothing had changed only waiter there was the dirty waiter I just spoke about, not to mention the restaurant was also filthy. You should not have to expect this kind of behavior, especially a filthy waiter serving food. I will also be contacting the health department. I am one individual you is up to my neck with this type of behavior coming from any type of business.

YmvpvLr2i4skpR7uhK0c6A.text: Jerrys Restaurant  This is a great place with great comfort food, just like mom made it.  The staff is excellent and Jerry's is open 24 hours. I've had breakfast, lunch, and dinner here.  I highly recommend stopping in anytime. B. Woods

photos.caption: Photo of Jerry's Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

x2_zdNeas4kBUwwzTUN9CQ.text: 24 hours a day 7 days a week 365 days a year.  Spaghetti Thursday is a great deal! Staff is friendly, bit dicey but always beats IHOP

P6-vjgokSuw96dehqB041Q.text: First, they are short on staff.. It looked like there were 2 cooks and 2 waitresses. So the wait was understandable due to the staff.  Sitting down after waiting for about 10 min to be seated we ordered drinks. The lady that sat us was our waitress. She seemed nice. So we order drinks, and when she gets back we know what we want and order food. 20-30 min later food is here but it's not our order. She comes back with our food but my order is wrong. Grr.. So she asks me what my order was and she brought me my order.   The food was good, I have no complaints about that. I ordered the Bacon and Egg with a side of toast. (She brought hash browns that was free) Hubby ordered country fried steak and eggs- filling and good per hubby.  So with all that said, will I go back- maybe.  They definitely need to work on their accuracy but overall I did NOT have a HORRIBLE experience. For that I give 3 stars.

HHI_fVmvVKVEzEYx2dJP5Q.text: Generous amounts of good, basic, but tasty diner food.  Very moderately priced. Loved the music from the fifties,  sixties, seventies, eighties?  Or thereabouts. Definitely worth going to if you are anywhere within five miles or so.

E61io53l69wl2LkRocZFzw.text: If I could give an extra star I would.  The food is very good, it is very reasonably priced, our waitress was great-- very friendly, decent paced, very helpful. Definitely recommend and definitely will be back.

YNw6SgqgROuUtkawzdmV9g.text: Driving down Phoenix busy road looking for a place to sit down and have dinner we found this place thanks to yelps help a very clean and friendly looking mom-and-pop restaurant open 24 hours a day the menu was very decent with low prices and reasonable for a family's budget Samantha was our waitress very friendly nice and professional.   We had a very pleasant time very clean atmosphere once again the food was good wasn't the best fish I've ever eaten but good fish very classy feel even the chairs look new and feel new.  Easy and easy out.

ouhrzzdLuyfxC-PWUC7bmg.text: Had the California smash burger during lunch. Fair amount of people were eating which is always a good sign. Had my iced tea within a minute and food came out quickly. Great diner vibe with booths, counter and era music. Burger was excellent and the fries were seasoned well. Nate was a superb waiter. Never had to ask for anything.

hopg32MdmRZTcZ27SjNcrQ.text: we had a wonderful time at Jerrys Patrick was so helpful and kind that he will be the reason we will be returning for a late night snack. thank you Patrick Blair for your awesome service. see you soon.

dV8N5wCYf-_6jymDgnCEGA.text: Jerry's is one of those diners we've all been to. It's been around forever..  The best time to go for good service is between the main meal times. Otherwise you will spend quite awhile waiting for service , drinks, meals or refills.  The food seems to be kinda inconsistent.. Today my ham steak was delish, but my hashbrowns were cold and undercooked.  My waitress was very sweet.. kept my glass filled without having to ask her.  Avoid at all costs if they are packed or there is a large group in the back seating area.. you will fall asleep before getting your food..  Over all decent.. good value.. will return..

tVbApLyh7deOPsY5QTNZRw.text: There are good greasy spoon restaurants and bad ones.  This one isn't good Simply: Stingy portions  Low quality ingredients: what they call Swiss cheese is white plastic American cheese ... yuk! One visit worth two: first and last

Our food wasn't the best but our service was and because of that we will be back...  Hope you had a better day sir and we will see u again for lunch

xh0SnvfUrEPQd9sAgQFRPQ.text: This place is great for a classic diner and traditional breakfast. My husband had the taco omelette (swapped beef for chicken) and I had the Benedict (swapped ham for mushrooms) and we both really enjoyed it. 1 cup of coffee and the meal was $23. Very fair, great service, we will be back!

Vsx0HiaH-4rLhfNgAl4z7Q.text: Don't know why this place has the star rating it does. It's an old school diner... You get good rich food, hot coffee and old school service from the servers. I had the chorizo omelette. It was excellent. Not too greasy, very flavorful, and served with hot salsa to cut through the fat. I love the ambience! Will be back!

_Rjn_xbq-CcOLTMxAgNqkw.text: The food deserves more than 2 stars, it's really pretty good. The service just drags it down and makes it an unenjoyable experience. Every time I've gone it takes a while to get seated. Not because they are busy: plenty of staff walk right by me and keep going. Getting an order right has happened only once out of 5 visits. Something is  either missing or I'm brought the wrong item altogether. The real shame is the staff are nice but it seems like training just does not happen. It's bad enough that I'll never return.

ef0PkF80CF6mI0ODet1w5A.text: Typical diner food.  Reasonably good.  Open 24 hrs.  Friendly staff. If you are in the area much better choice than 24 hr chains.

8p9NaeH_OgX_5KIKEDxZPA.text: Taste of Americana!  These kind of places are vanishing across America as the new generation frequent the heavily advertised, absolutely boring, Franchise Chains. You gotta stop in here just for the nostalgia & 24 hour people watching.  Is it dated, you betcha. Has it seen better days, no doubt. Has the food quality slipped during the last couple of decades, yup! But thats not the point ... its funky, colorful, with just the right amount of wear around the edges to flip the middle finger at the future.   Where else can you get a ham steak the size of your plate so gloriously salty you can't even eat it. Fried chicken, while now small, at least still tastes like "real" fried chicken. Or try my favorite, sliced turkey and gravy over a bed of potatoes o'brien ... oh baby!   Stop in and get your fix of 20th Century diner food before it fades into darkness.

LHBc3q8AWhkYXjkbyh9lLg.text: Nice and friendly service.  Good food and great menu selection for whatever your tastebuds or cravings may be

KfHOcSAItEJIV2U9Sx9Gbg.text: Delicious chicken fried steak and friendly service.  Food is really tasty, decor is no nonsense and portion size is huge.  Food comes out fast and the place is clean and open 24 hours.  Coffees is average but I'm comparing to first watch.  Biscuits are fresh and location is close to home.  This is my favorite greasy spoon.

8LrthUTjVGgYSEM3LrcWwg.text: I've lived in this valley now for over ten years; heck, I'm practically a native!!! I cannot tell you how many times we've driven by this restaurant, but a couple weekends ago, we stopped in for a quiet dinner.   Our love for things vintage and ''old-school'' is well represented in this eatery. Great vintage posters on the bathroom walls, classically appointed with well-maintained seating/dining areas, and personable staff that makes you feel right at home and happy you stopped in.  I had the special lasagne with salad and French bread and my boyfriend had a delicious mushroom burger, cooked to order. Neither one of us left hungry or feeling cheated. The food was excellent; service was great, and the prices were very good. We spent about an hour total, but with the ambience of the place, we put down our phones and had an honest to goodness conversation like back in the olden days before technology took over.  It's a great place to reconnect with humanity and each other. The food is fabulous, the atmosphere is peaceful, and the server we had was an exceptional woman with a great attitude.  Definitely worth a high rating and we will be eating there many more times. Feed yourself well, both physically and mentally. Jerry's is hometown kind of food!!!

vbKIxBcHz1DVqa3wKk9WLA.text: I heard nothing but great things about Jerry's, so I finally tried it.  I ordered a Ruben sandwich.  After waiting 20 minutes the sandwich arrived. I tried to take a bite out of it and thought I was biting into leather. The corn beef was so tuff. I took another bite and it was the same. I sent the sandwich back and ordered a burger. Omg..the burger was so dry. The people were pleasant, very friendly. Our waiter Diego kept on moving his hair with his hands while waiting on u and wiping his nose with his hand while touching our plates. Very unsanitary!!!  Don't know if I'll b back

yek2XO4sSb53TLozzDqtzg.text: Open 24 hours with a full menu. Nice because it's different than the standard 24 hour ihop or dennys. Definitely different types of crowds and cliental. Foods average priced, decent quality and you dont have to wait long. I had the chicken fried steak with eggs and hashbrowns. Pretty awesome for a 3am breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Jerry's Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jerrys- downtown phoenix

oYLKDqFfKxD1CjH6ClGEtQ.text: We came here only because we picked up my mother-in-law at the air port and we were all starving. When we got seated it took us 10 min to finally get someone to come and get our drink order, but before we could order a drink for my daughter she left. After she brings our drinks we ask her for a kids drink and she brings it. Then 5 mins later we ask her if we can order and she replies, "only if you know what to drink because I have other things to do right now" so we order. Everyone's food comes out except for mine, it takes an hour for my food to finally come out and it was so gross! Nobody ever came to apologize or make sure we were okay. I think it's safe to say I will never return there EVER!!

kJoX3vx19PQBuIhyMesWIA.text: Stopped in for breakfast. I was slightly disappointed that there was no sweet tea. My southern affinity for it gave them demerits for missing something that is an integral part of my breakfast. I need it to wake me up. And I don't care for coffee. It was a sad moment in breakfast history. That being said, the food and service was good. The pancakes actually had flavor! I think lots of restaurants cut corners and use cheap mixes that taste like cardboard. That was not the case here. The pancakes had decent flavor. Nothing really blew me away here though.

dawSU1qyS7DNLOg3SW-EOA.text: Love Jerry's! Have been coming here for the last 20 yrs. Had my usual this morning, 222. Two eggs, two bacon and two pancakes.  Oh... Coffee :-)

xaWi5d68mm-mV5LTla1fMQ.text: My boyfriend and I have made it a point to visit different places to eat any time that we could, most times locally. It was very late at night so I was glad to see Jerry's open; we decided to give it a try.   Ambience: The people who were already seating and eating seemed like they knew the kitchen and waitress very well. It was quiet, but I assume it was because it was at midnight.   Food: My spinach and eggs dish was very bland. I didn't care to finish the dish or take it home at all. The water (I had hot water and my boyfriend had iced) was very good though for some reason. It tasted a bit sweet? I was addicted to it.   Other: Our waitress wasn't rude but she sort of had a meh attitude. I definitely don't mind it but it was an effort to try to ask for condiments and water refills.

photos.caption: Photo of Jerry's Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. spinach florentine scrabble.

WDSGwj_lBVl1pyv3-vTgSQ.text: Came here and it was slow, my buddy and I had just finished hiking camelback. Food was average diner food and nothing special yet nothing bad. Service is prompt and our server was very nice. I ordered the traveler which comes with unlimited pancakes, and it was tasty, and my friend ordered the bus which he loved. Will come back here again for sure and I hope the service is consistent.

wzeE1KnTJ8PTJc-VpLFztg.text: Jerry's is a True original "lunch counter" dinner. Located just minutes from Sky Harbor International Airport and next door to the Embassy Suites its a convenient location. Open 24 hours a day and seven days a week makes it a top pick.   The menu offers a large selection of breakfast options served anytime.  From Old fashioned home made biscuits and Sausage gravy to pot toast and vegetables.  The menu has something for everyone.  I am all about finding a place that still offers homemade pies. Jerry's is that place.  A variety of homemade pies and fresh baked rolls and cakes. Another plus is a good old fashion hand made shake. I would like to see them offer malts as well.   The service was very good as well. I happen to be in town for business and staying next door at the Embassy Suites. I would call over in the evening and place my order to go. They were great about making sure that I had everything needed to cook/reheat the entree in my room.

photos.caption: Photo of Jerry's Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. An old-fashioned dinner.

azQgsx2Rfj1Cq7doDMAR_Q.text: Nope. Cold food, dirty restaurant, lousy service.  I'll spend my money elsewhere thanks.

glB2eee0mAgyt2MtuWiWlA.text: Very good food if your needing a change from your regular breakfast routine. Good food and not expensive. Always quiet and quick service. This place is old but not run-down, the owner obviously keeps the place up very nicely.

ljo66LP5AZobMTTNzQ5QXw.text: Great mom and pop shop hop drop! It's home cooking, with love! Tracy is amazing, one of many outstanding waitress.! I love the biscuits and gravy, it's from out of this world! Highly recommended for a wholesome meal with great company!

wPQYRDQ3G57oNomVycHIPQ.text: First time here- first impression was of a family owned diner, not too terribly busy at 10:00 am in a Sunday - no wait.    Waiter took my drink order as he seated me - good strong coffee!   I had the corned beef hash and eggs - hash browns  look like they are shredded in house -liked that.   Only downside was bathrooms weren't too clean and smelled like puke.    It's right around the corner so I'll probably be back!

FR8xDZutmcAtxgsACx-mKw.text: I've been in the process of moving, and have been Cox-blocked several times. (Was cut off at my old house too soon, having issues getting service at the new place.) I don't have a smart phone - so I really need internet access to coordinate the move and stay in touch with the outside world.  Denny's and Starbucks lost my interest very quickly. I needed wifi access, and I am more than happy to be a paying customer to get it. Oh, and I keep a late night schedule.  Enter Jerry's. Not far from the new house, open 24/7, and wifi access as requested.  Until this past week, I hadn't been into Jerry's in almost 20 years. I am so sorry it fell off my radar - this is a great place for a quick and affordable meal anytime day or night. And - quite the happy surprise - the food is pretty damn tasty!  Late night, visit #1 - I wasn't really hungry, but thought it would be tacky to just nurse an iced tea, so I was going to get a slice of dessert. (Offerings were apple, cherry, Boston Creme and Lemon Meringue pie, Chocolate or Lemon cake.) Then the waitress mentioned something about the awesome cinnamon roll with whipped butter, and that sounded perfect. AND IT WAS!  Late morning - visit #2 - Coffee and a Reuben sandwich with fries. Quite possibly the best diner Reuben a girl could ask for! YUM.  Lunch time - visit #3 - I brought a friend today. (Cox was supposed to connect me this morning, she was going to set up my home network. That didn't happen, so the least I could do was buy her lunch.) She had iced tea and a grilled club, I had iced coffee and a hamburger. I was super happy. Her only complaint was all the bacon seemed to be on one side of the sandwich - so she had to open it up to rebalance.  I am happy to have Jerry's nearby - and will most likely be in fairly often  - even when I can access the internet at home. Breakfast 24 hours a day? Yummy desserts? Friendly servers? Reasonable prices? Check, check, check and CHECK!

EYhSdUcTMmV6EfQ_4NT7kA.text: I am happy to say that I enjoy this restaurant.  The wait staff is smart and funny, the food arrives promptly, and is definitely better than you'd expect. I'll admit, the sign that says "Jerry's Restaurant" out front makes it look like it sucks inside, but it doesn't. Think of a classier version of Waffle House, with more menu choices and great coffee.   Today we had chicken fried steak with gravy, an egg scramble-thingy, biscuits, hash browns, corned beef hash (my fave), and sourdough toast. All the items came out super hot and fast, and were very flavorful. The steak was lightly breaded, semi-salty, loaded with gravy. The hash, although a little underdone for my tastes, reminded me of food I ate while growing up in the midwest. The eggs were good, and the sourdough toast sopped up those tasty yolks nicely. Yessir, Jerry's has mastered the perfect American breakfast.   While paying on the way out, the owner-lady mentioned something to the waitress who was ringing us up. She whispered, "the special tonight is really good, I'm so excited..." then slipped her a little sample of the night's special in a ramekin and I think may have actually winked at us.  Glad to know that she takes pride in her place and her food, and appreciates her staff.  Pros: chicken fried steak, gravy, biscuits w/orange marmalade, coffee, functional salt & pepper shakers, you can probably get away with wearing your pajamas if you are hungover, obscure Star Trek doll in toy grab game in lobby  Cons: decor, location, nothing out of the ordinary on the menu, ding you on extras  Give it a shot - its a local business and its good eatin. Oh fyi - you pay up front.

yFwjdvZChMgFiVBJML-vHw.text: This place is really one of the very best 24-7 spots in the valley in my honest opinion...Way better than Denny's, Waffle House etc.  Centrally located at 24th st & Thomas! HEVyvX3J5-PKSAp3VFpkDQ.text: When I hear people complain about Jerry's having "typical diner food," I want to scream because that's what makes this place great. It is a typical diner in a sea of casual and upscale dining buffoonery and pretension. When all you want is a great cup of coffee and a decent breakfast in a zero concept atmosphere, then Jerry's is a solid choice.

bv1Ekm0Z1uSMsIOEs8Iszw.text: This place is absolutely awesome. Somebody is putting a lot of work and running it with an iron hand. The servers are very polite, they're somewhat formal which is refreshing. The place is immaculate with lots of great decor.   The food is excellent and surprisingly inventively prepared. I had the Philadelphia cheesesteak and was markedly impressed by the fact that it was not drowning in cheese; I didn't think it'd be that good because it didn't look like the usual Philly cheesesteak. When I bit into it, it was a celebration of peppers meat seasoning and the right amount of cheese. It doesn't look like a Philly cheese steak but it was the best one I've ever had. If you are in downtown Phoenix, you are cheating yourself if you don't come here.  Do yourself a favor, come here for a casual meal and bathe in this awesome retro atmosphere and enjoy the excellent service and food.

PkRdunh1eyXemKLjM1_VSA.text: The staff are all kind and very attentive. This restaurant is very welcoming and we are always comfortable here. The food is really good and decent prices!! Come give it a try!

mqkKc4zgMufPUQIdw3z9vw.text: Yo..where to begin?! This place is awesome. Let's start with the staff. Patrick was just a GEM! He knew the menu so well, but he encouraged us to be creative and even suggested some of his favorite items and changes to his favorite items! Then, we got to meet Michael..who is probably the head chef because he was talking about doing all kinds of cool stuff with the food. These guys were a wealth of knowledge and we really enjoyed chatting with them about not just food, but also the philosophies of Violent J and Shaggy 2 Dope! It was great. Now onto the food!! I was so excited when Patrick told me I wasn't shackled by the strictures of the description of the "Rock and Roll Waffle" and he allowed me to have my fried egg on the side, instead of on top of my waffle (as the menu stated) The menu ALSO made it seem as though I couldn't even HAVE a Waffle. I understand that they typically don't keep the irons all all night, which makes sense but I was SO excited when Patrick vetoed that bullshit! Rejoice!! My companion ordered the Strawberry Road cakes and here is his review: "The burst of flavor was positively sinful. I felt as if the pancakes, aided by the bouquet of whipped cream and strawberries, kissed my palette in ways that made me uncomfortable..in the best way." So yeah..you should probably go here.

photos.caption: Photo of Jerry's Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oh to be that fork..

vWgiz84l6FU1g7mfoRJuuw.text: It was our last night in Phoenix and we were checking in next door at the Embassy Suites and had to leave for the Airport at 6 in the morning.   But what caught my eye was this 24 Hour Diner called Jerry's Restaurant next door  which reminded me of this old Mom and Pop's Diners that you just don't see anymore. It was like something out of a scene from Pulp Fiction where Samuel and John were eating at this type of diner and I was hoping that this diner was one of those 24 hour ones.   And perusing through the Yelp App, I found out that they were open 24 hours so there is no way in hell that I am not gonna eat here before I go back to Honolulu so this is the place we are going to eat at the crack of dawn right before we head out to Sky Harbor Airport.   So here we are at Jerry's Restaurant with menu in hand. This Restaurant has been open since 1966 and the menu has just about everything you could imagine when you come up a place like this.   I ordered Waffles,Eggs, and a side of Ham Steak which was the size of Shaquille O Neal's head!!! They don't mess around with portions here. They give out Samoan style portions here at Jerry's and that's just fine by me.   Despite what other reviewers said about the service here, our server was great and had a great and upbeat personality despite it being so early in the morning.    The restaurant wasn't crowded that early but you can tell that there are a lot of regulars that cone here frequently and I can see why. The prices here are very reasonable and not eye gouging.   Our breakfast sure hit the spot and what way to end our Arizona Vacation and head back home to Honolulu on a happy note. I love the nostalgia and atmosphere of these diner's that are a dying breed.   A great place indeed.....

E7B8X9L37cuBGgNPmmDoCQ.text: I had written my original review after the first time I went here.  Since then, I have probably been about 20 more times.  This place is totally a 5 star, bombastic breakfast diner.  The waitress is amazingly quick and on top of things.  I really appreciate that attentiveness in the morning.  The kitchen kicks out food just as quickly and it sure is good.  I've tried the sausage and eggs (which is a giant polish sausage that has been grilled) and "The Bus" (which is a huge piece of ham).  The food is always great and the bill is always under $20 for both of us.  This is our fallback for breakfast now.  No more Denny's or IHOP - ALWAYS JERRY'S.  We even went Christmas morning while waiting for the family to wake up.  This place is top notch.

K9Ope7FDX-hIzPxhktLBAQ.text: Sometimes during the day you get a hankering for some breakfast food... no not cereal, or a fruit cup with some yogurt, or a pop tart, sheesh not that! But, some yummy medium fried eggs or scrambled, with sizzling bacon, or links, and pancakes...... mmmmmmmmmmmm! And you think, where o where can I grab some goodness? So you think the usual suspects, IHOP, eh, 5&Diner, possibly, Denny's, ummm no, Village Inn, yuck. And then you think of that breakfast place you went to for hangover brunch, and you're like, no i want cheap food... so you keep on thinking until you lose interest and that hankering goes away which is kinda good if you're on a diet but heck it's breakfast food so it's good for you even when you have brinner! Well... my phoenicians there's a place that can satisfy those cravings, good diner food, friendly service, and cheap ass places and this mythical place is known as Jerry's Restaurant (since 1966) and it's 24 hours! See ya gay 5 & diner at 16th st, and Jenny's (drag queen denny's) on 7th ave, and hello butch Jerry's!   Recommended items - the Fried Chicken! the Big Bertha's Country Fried Steak and Eggs, the hungry traveler ( unlimited pancakes, 3 eggs, 6 bacon or links all for $7.99), and the of all things yum and gooey... their cinnamon roll with whipped butter... uh yea it's on my list of food items that i want on my table before the world ends in 2012.   Yea it's a geriatric central but you gotta love old people and old ladies that are servers who all have some attitude and sweetness altho the gay server has total cattyness... rowr... this gay boy wasn't gonna have it tho... if you're a bitch to me i'm a bitch to you... easy as that!  I love the setting, and the location.

wWgqur69zwhWOdpTh3HgXQ.text: I went to Jerry's last night for dinner.  We always eat there and usually like the atmosphere.  This time there were protesters there with anti-Nazi signs.  They told me that a man was present signing books and speaking to a group of people.  His name is David Irving and he was invited to speak by the group about his beliefs that the Holocaust didn't happen.  And that Hitler never knew about the Jews being slaughtered.  This is sick and made me lose my appetite.  Why would a restaurant like Jerry's support a local Neo-Nazi group?  Apparently, they hold the monthly meetings of the group there as well.  I do not plan to return to this location for any meal in case I run across this type of hatred again. 4.9.12 Since that time, I have been following the story of David Irving.  He has not returned to this restaurant again but went to a hotel near the airport maybe a year later.  It was guarded by the Phx police red squad.  At least the protesters wacked this mole back into his hole for now.

zisDr0iQYCvWxjEQ8UA7Ng.text: Took a family road trip with 23 people and stayed at the Embassy Suites which is literally next door to Jerry's Diner. Read the Yelp reviews - which consisted of a mix of good and bad - most likely from regulars and passer-thruers like us. Read about the horrible customer service and alright food. I understand a group of 23 can be difficult to accommodate, especially when you have other tables and low staffing - because yes, it is midnight. BUT, it is no excuse for a server to have no personality or conscience to check in on us and do all the extra things a waitress normally does. Everyone has bad days, but our waitress was dull, uninviting, and overall SUCKY. After we were served with water, it took her 10 minutes to come back to take our orders even though the place was empty and we told her we were ready. Then it took 1 hour and 15 minutes until the first plate of food was delivered! After the first 50 minutes of waiting, we had to walk up to the counter for an update and she said "we only have one cook... it'll be another 30 minutes at minimum". Please explain why 2 phone orders that were called in after our orders were done before ours? DO NOT COME HERE.  Update: Our waitress was Haileigh... It wasn't entirely her fault, but she didn't have the basic decency to update us. She kept telling us it was almost done when the food wasn't even on the grill. Our 1 hour and 45 minute wait was our limit and we walked out of there- half of us fed, half of us starving.

DzS8qB-og_0WSAjnJ6i1IA.text: Great comfort food, great prices, great service, great hours (24 hours). This place is a hidden gem! My girl had the Ozzie plate and I had the Traveler's plate. The atmosphere is perfect for a low key hangout meal.

Hey it isn't five star dining but as someone else put it, they serve good comfort food at a decent price.  BUT.... uh oh....WHAT HAPPENED TO BEING OPEN 24 HOURS?  A couple of weeks ago they stopped being open all night.  I kept thinking it was because maybe they didn't have a cook to work nights or something but they still are closing over night.  I'm sad they aren't open 24 hours anymore but hey...I get it.  The business just isn't there to warrant being open.  I'm just glad they are still around and didn't close down altogether ! oUg76jUSxrQD20QFx_Ueuw.text: Service was great.   Server was Joe.  Food was delish.  Definitely will be coming back

sfNwBgs1DtxewLSsene8yA.text: Service was horrible.  Waitress was sitting down in the booths talking instead of doing her job.  They really couldn't care less about their customers.  Horrible experience.

VpLIVgoRQlKI4Tjqr-J3WA.text: The food is delicious, prices are great but service absolutely sucks! This our second time here, staff has been rude and rushed. I don't fully blame the staff as it seems there's inadequate staffing to meet the restaurants needs. Plan on a longer than usual visit.

IrY5WkNBTlgKsCPzZ9u97g.text: So this is a greasy spoon. Service is not the greatest, food takes forever, but you get what you pay for. You're going to come here and eat the hamburger or the patty melt. Don't waste your time with salads, and your not going to get escargot. It is what it is.............

photos.caption: Photo of Jerry's Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

30-051Vf6dbJmSmlEGcSIw.text: I was so excited to see a Jerry's still exist. These places were all the rage back in the Southeastern part of the US in the 80's and early 90's.  Unfortunately, this was quite possibly one of the worse restaurants I have ever eaten at. The food was simply awful and the menu was incorrect (or staff didn't care to follow it). I was there at 6pm on a weeknight and it was dead.  I ordered the Fish and Chips meal with fries and what the menu and waitress described as "fresh green beans" and corn bread. When the food arrived it was served with "texas toast" that was the smallest piece of bread I've ever seen to go along with cold, stale fries. The green beans were out of a can and devoid of any flavor at all. Finally the fish...oh the fish. It was minced Mrs. Paul's. No really, not kidding. Same size, flavor, color, and everything else.  My wife ordered the bacon, scrambled eggs, and toast. The menu said 3 pieces of bacon, but she got 2. The menu said 2 eggs...this was probably 1/2 of a single egg and it was runny. Finally the toast wasn't toasted at all.  Maybe if this was really cheap food, this score would be a little higher but sadly, it wasn't cheap either. $28 for stale fries, Del Monte green beans, 2 pieces of Mrs Paul's fish, 2 strips of paper-thin bacon, half a barely cooked egg, and 2 slices of Wonderbread.

_goGqBX55QtMp_dBfc_OOA.text: We went for breakfast.  I ordered coffee and water to start.  I never got the water.  I barely got the waitress to begrudgingly refill the coffee once.  My friend ordered the special, Chicken & Waffles.  The waffle came, but not the chicken.  We had to request the chicken and by the time it came, he had already eaten the waffle.  I ordered the bus which is  ham steak, eggs, hash browns and toast.  All of it was cold!  I have had decent meals there, but after today, I don't think I will go back.

SZ1CfstFNSir-eOaNL9WJw.text: We love Jerrys. Always come for breakfast on the weekends.  Just want it noted that the last few times the food took forever to come out.  Was there this morning.  Maybe 30 people total in the place. At least 5 servers working.  They are always nice! I feel bad for them because they are the ones getting grief for the slow Kitchen. Our server offered us a cinnamon roll while we waited. We declined... but certainly appreciated it.  5 stars because the food ( when it does arrive) and service great.  But whatever is going on in the kitchen.... they better get that worked out.

dWTGCiYe42BE3hjUMF4s4w.text: I stopped by  for a very early, 4am, breakfast before work.  They are supposed to be 24/7 but, the restaurant was locked up tight and no one answered phone calls or knocks at the door.

_gBZt3J4whe3Q5fTBc2WDQ.text: Great place for a cheap home style meal. I've lived down the road for a few years now and have always thought about trying it, then yesterday I finally did. Needless to say I was very impressed, I didn't expect much but I had gotten the chicken fried steak breakfast and it was fantastic. The service was great, and the staff was very tentative. I will be returning and referring. And as far as the bad reviews go, they probably just had bad service on a servers off day, or their standards of food is waaay to high. It's a five star in my book and I'm pretty picky.

x8B5_mgUZU7VVnsTHOCnyQ.text: Get the Fried Chicken, Can't miss out on a 24 hour place This place has been around since 1966 and has 8 reviews? well anyways a classic dinner in the area, if you have a group you can meet in a back area.  So I asked "whats good here Wendy" she said fried chicken so I got it, it came with choice of salad or soap and a side dish. wow that really impressed me.  I love a place where I can check good for everything.

bhrW73Tkf_1kBmA6LyOwEg.text: Can you say SYSCO?  Almost nothing served at this restaurant is made in house. If I want plastic wrapped pre-fab food, I can buy it at Costco.  The only thing made in house the night we visited was the Meatloaf. It was mediocre. We won't return unless my wife gets a high powered hankering for chocolate cake.

c2F_UR44yzAH_XLkqoeYqw.text: I had a turkey sandwich and a fudge sundae.  Mmm mm.  Jerry's is like a good version of Denny's or any of those late night diners.  It was difficult for me to wrap my head around the concept of a 'good' denny's, but their food is actually tastey, their booths are comfortable, it feels like a diner the way it's set up, and they didn't fuck up a sundae.    Oh and I didn't feel sick or gross after eating there AND I saved half my sandwich for later.  Now that's a level of diner food that is deserving of 5 stars!

9m58wyLosQt-IGHP8TZxwQ.text: This is a great place to go to after work.  It is a great diner that offers home style cooking. The food always tastes fresh and is reasonably priced.  I will continue to go there.

ZWdLaNU7TMRMPCMX3lMYXA.text: First time trying the place. Had my doubts and my doubts were right. Cute place, cute menu but god awful food. Started off with potato crunchers (jalapeno like poppers) $4.99 those were good but the food didn't make up for the poppers. Ordered the honey fried chicken (8.99) which comes with: carrots, side salad (horrible), cornbread (inedible) and french fries (good). Husband had chix fried steak. BLECH!!! that's all I can say. I really liked the carrots and though they were the bet part of the meal. Let's just say don't waste your time.

cghu5nAUKyTtIUIzw9oSQA.text: Jerry's is what it is- decent, classic diner food. Super cheap, too! I would choose to eat here over Denny's any day.   Last night, Hubby and I had dinner here. The navy bean soup that was part of my entree was delicious, and so large a bowl we shared it. I had the pot roast, which was yummy and quite tender, but not at all fatty. It came with mediocre boxed mashed potatoes, decent corn, and really good Texas Toast. Hubby had a corned beef sandwich with grilled onions and green peppers which he liked well enough, and it came with macaroni salad that he loved. It was simple, but had lots of super crispy and fresh pieces of onion and celery.  I have also had breakfast at Jerry's twice and both times it was delicious, with eggs cooked just as I ordered them. One caveat- the iced tea is super strong and had us up 'til the wee hours.  Give Jerry's a try if you find yourself on Thomas across the street from the Stuffington Bear Factory.  Three and a half stars.

h3_zr5FjCfjbe-3CLgiZcw.text: Food was excellent. Had the chicken fried steak, taco salad and my 3yr old son had the chicken fingers. I have no complaints, what so ever, about the food but the service was just awful.  If you can get past the terrible service then this place is great. Maybe I'll try again another time and see if it was just the waiter working today that sucked.  Update: No longer see the waiter that gave us bad service. All the new staff I have encountered is top notch and food is still delicious.

VRXUADUciUntRruIK3KsIw.text: Had to write a quick review to this place.  It kicks Denny's ASS.  The food is always done well, eggs made to order, fries always hot and crispy.  Sandwiches are full of good, fresh ingredients, breakfasts are all delish. Waitresses are a good sweet/salty combo. My friend made a side comment the last time about wanting my pickle, because she had breakfast and I had a sammy. The waitress, without a word, came back to the table with a plate of the crisp briny spears. Nice xtra touch!  All in all a pleasant,cheap, laid back, 24/7 diner, which is damn hard to come by in this day and age.

S8x2YiZ332sqYoJmeoTcBg.text: I have lived around the corner from this diner for almost 2 years now and go there maybe 2 or 3 times a month. It has character and the wait staff is pleasant. The food is typical diner style...which is what i want when i go here. We have never had a bad experience except for getting crappy corn bread just one time.

PsY9NC9h-YGPJU1TErdvmg.text: Breakfast served all day. I had the chorizo scramble...very good,. Waitress was very attentive and friendly.  Love the decor very 60's went back for Dinner and LOVED the Burgers! Homemade and best I have had in a LONG time.

EcGfN0IjQC05kJ39XkuhRw.text: Entered restaurant and creepy Mexican guy came out to entrance of Jerry's ; then  he retreated behind the kitchen counter - I guess he  was the cook.   Waitress then came to my table and took my order. Food arrived a little while later - sandwich and fries that I ordered  were pretty good.     I would give Jerry's 3 stars if the creepy Mexican did not show up..

V5ja2m07km83p9odO2VyAQ.text: Average diner but cheaper than embassy hotel food.

mUMVQ_BXe1XDGO5MIX5RNQ.text: YUMMY... the belgian waffle was so delicious just the right crispness on the out side and warm and chewy on the inside..great waitress.clean place....love love love it..

NyvqL8DXu2JuEfbBtt3-xQ.text: I really like this place. They have awesome waitresses; they're always so nice and sweet to us when we come in. I love that it's a diner and it hits the spot when I have a mad craving for breakfast food. I love getting their country fried steak, which is like twice as big as the portion sizes you can get at the other places, like Denny's and such. Their serving sizes here are huge in general. The cinnamon bun, which is delish with the melted butter, is pretty big; it looks like it's be as big as one of my jazz hands. The fried chicken is yummy although, I don't really care for their veggie sides cause they're over cooked and all the goodness seems to be gone. I think that's my only complaint about the place.

_ynPLd9y1wM3NIJgZVki5A.text: Good food for a fair price. Classic American fare with a variety of items. Awesome chicken fried steak!

XfhkEWe7Mp4S5Gv-CgOjcQ.text: My friend and I ate here this past Saturday after she read some reviews.  We were looking for breakfast that wasn't pretentious, pricey or took 2 hours to finish.  I honestly expected an old school diner with layers of smoke leftover from the smoking days and some greasy spoon fare.    The place is incredibly clean nicely redone.  The average age is about 60 and I love the old dudes at the counter reading the paper.     The coffee was good, pancakes big and fluffy, egg over easy done well, bacon was a little wimpy but crispy.  My friend had french toast; 4 big slices, warm syrup, same egg and bacon set up.    The service was a bit slow but we were both enthusiastic to find a new breakfast spot.  We're eager to return to try other menu items.

tNdARCewA_g2yLu89o61OQ.text: Stopped in for breakfast today since I now live close by. Arrived around 9:15am, so after the usual breakfast rush. There were just two servers on for the place. Service was slow to say the least. I had the male server (Joe, I think). He was robotic and without a personality. At least the lady who was working most of the restaurant seemed to have some personality to her. Once I finally got my order taken, the food did arrive quickly and was piping hot.. So it wasn't the kitchen that was slowing things down, it was the server. Corned beef hash was generic and obviously straight out of the can.. The poached eggs were cooked with soft yolks, so I give the cooks credit for knowing how to poach an egg. The potatoes and toast were pretty standard issue stuff. Nothing out of the ordinary and nothing wrong with them. For the food, I would give them a solid 3.. But the service (or lack there of) brought the experience down to a 2. I say Mehhh.. nothing worth coming back for anytime soon.

fdzBg4zztG5FfKHeEu4zag.text: I don't know what I was thinking.  It was lunchtime on Friday and we drove past Jerry's and thought, "What the hell, let's give it a try".  Not sure if it was just a bad day or a bad restaurant.  The kitchen was backed up for 45 minutes with the restaurant only half full.  After a long wait, 2 out of 3 orders were wrong and no one liked what did show up on their plate.  I got the Pollack "all you can eat" fish fry.  Wow, was it disappointing after the long wait.  The plate showed up with basically one semi-large fish stick.  I stared at it for a few minutes in shock at the lack of food and honestly, gross presentation.  I'm not some snooty guy and I was expecting something in the Denny's/Shari's realm but wow was it worse.  Rather than dive in, I pulled a Gordon Ramsey and pulled apart the fish stick to see what was inside.  As big as it was, there was almost no fish.  Ate a bite of fish and couldn't continue.  I was so frustrated by the experience and the sub-par food that I couldn't bring myself to eat it.  In my entire life, I have never sent anything back to the kitchen, until today.  The waitress came around eventually and I let her know that I was sending it back.  She offered to bring out another dish but I was too irritated and couldn't wait another 45 minutes anyway.  I don't believe I've ever been more disappointed in a meal and I walked in with low expectations.  I've read on other reviews that the breakfast is good.  The other two people in my party ordered the breakfast and also had negative reviews but they were too hungry to send it back.  An all-around bomb of a place.  Maybe it was just an off day but I'll never find out.

_TB1kmZqsp3dxeEqOwywLw.text: We were in my parents neighborhood & wanted to take them for breakfast.   I stepped out of my comfort zone & ordered Scrambled eggs w/ cream cheese. They were so good! I am now looking for a recipe online so I can make my own!  We arrived right before they got busy, so our service was great at 1st then we had to wait for our check as there seemed to be only 3 people working in at morning.  I will go back if I ever have the chance.

UtgjOqIBfStLagU8YwEghA.text: YES 5 stars. Ive lived in the neighborhood and never have been to Jerrys because I figured it was a cheap knock off of Dennys. I was very wrong. Instead this place is a throw back to old school neighborhood dinners with most of the clientel as regulars. I have to say I have not seen this high level of 'professional 'servers in a very long time. They were courteous, organized and efficient with a genuine smile. Lets talk food, when it arrived I could not believe the presentation of the meal. Again not just slop on a plate but very appetizing to the senses. I have not had macaroni salad that perfect since...well maybe never. Not tart and not too creamy, just perfect. The omlete was perfectly  prepared and consistently cooked .  When I checked out, the hostess was quick to cash me out, not some 16yr old but a professional hostess. This dinner is straight out of a Tarantino film, except it is not strangely in the middle of nowhere (ever notice that?). This was high end Las Vegas service. You now have another regular.

U_pcT2PT3Vu8bRHYTewM3Q.text: I moved into this area about 4 months ago and have been keeping a running list of places to try, this was one. So glad I did. They were open Thanksgiving morning which was helpful to me. Tired of cooking I just wanted out of the house for a bit and this place was perfect.   The dishes are typical diner food and that's exactly what you want when you go to a diner. I have been here twice. Once for breakfast and once for lunch. The eggs, bacon and pancakes were delicious and so was the traditional grilled cheese and fries.   The waitstaff is friendly and the service is speedy. This is a throwback to what a diner should be like. We'll be back. Often.   Update: So sorry to hear they are closing.

y9lFXEFLsLbzYF4VvCouWw.text: Talk about a legit post-move-your-friend-into-her-first-house breakfast!  I've never heard of this place before, and my thoughts naturally went to Monk's Cafe from the Seinfeld series.  Just in case you were curious, they have nothing in common.  While there may be no Moops, or Bubble Boy... they sure have perfected the Hungry Traveler which includes AYCE Pancakes (get the blueberry ones), 3 eggs, hash browns and 6 (count them, 6!) strips of bacon or sausage links or 4 sausage patties.  And all that food is only going to put you out $10.69 UNLESS you get the Groupon deal that'll give you 25% cash back!

photos.caption: Photo of Jerry's Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Hungry Traveler with 6 slices o bacon

89tHlUtjf8NDqHBYGp5jXA.text: Dining is often a matter of personal preference. Everyone's taste buds, preference of decor, and overall ambiance runs the gamut.  My preference is large tables, late a night. Provide me a decent breakfast food and decent service. And leave me alone for hours on end, especially at night, so that I can code and write - depending on my preference.  Seeing as that this place is off the beaten path, in a not so inviting part of town; it's often devoid of a plethora of patrons until about the 2-3AM hour. Or perhaps, during the lunch rush.  The tables here are immense! Nothing like the ones in the all night chains such as Denny's, IHOP, et al. You can really spread out and work (or write). And as long as you are a paying customer, they pretty much leave you alone.  The food is decent. I've primarily only ordered breakfast type foods here, regardless of the time of day. Definitely, not on par with the breakfast specialty places such as Snooze, Scramble, etc. But, decent enough in terms of affordability and portions.  The service here is prompt, caring, and friendly. It is not uncommon for me to engage whomever is working at that time in a long conversation about life, the universe and everything! (Tip of the hat to Douglas Adams fans out there)  I love the immense windows facing Thomas road. It affords me a great view of the passing traffic. It also allows me to keep an eye on my car, when I just happen to bring the red convertible with me late at night - after a date with my beloved.  I can sit here for hours (and I do), and just be quiet in both thoughts and/or work - or to just take in the passage of traffic, and time.  There are very few places wherein I can find sanctuary in the middle of the city.  During the summer, Ro Ho En (Japanese Gardens) is closed. Also, neither it, nor South Mountain park is accessible at night.  So, this place has become my sanctuary.   That is, until my peaceful serenity, lost in my thoughts and work; is summarily interrupted by the craziness of the 2:30 AM hour.  That is then my cue to head home to my Beloved!

jNY74b0N8H75VRBG-G5uWg.text: Unfortunately the customer service was no good the waitresses we're not very smiley and welcoming and when they said they would be right back with sour cream and chives I had to actually walk up to the counter and get it myself. Food was alright I guess but just seems like there is no one there to manage food temps and regulations. Will not be back

an_y4G3tpzQ7A_SPfa8enQ.text: I never had so much good food for so little that I payed, 3 adults and a baby -lol. No but seriously it was great. We were greeted oh so nicely n seated to our table by a super cool waitress who met all our needs, even my 13 month grandson was strangely behaving  (no outburst) I didn't expect it as when you first see the place from the outside is not much but once inside it's pretty nice , with vintage wall art pieces and pleasant people. We ate stake, fish, burgers all for $45. I'll always come here when I'm in town so should you!

photos.caption: Photo of Jerry's Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

i6NeOrfZ6GG0lyPpl0ESoA.text: I'm a fan of Jerry's. A traditional diner vibe and menu, but don't worry, the interior has been updated since it's founding. It doesn't really feel like it's part of a larger chain, which it is.  Love the goofy clocks on the wall with the times of different Arizona cities (all the same time of course).  Not an extremely inexpensive place to eat as diners go, but it's reasonably priced. Specials, if any, are posted by the front door. The kids menu is great and each meal includes a drink. The service seems much better during breakfast hours, which is when I would recommend your eat at Jerry's anyway.  Not for the person with a gourmet palate wanting trendy offerings. But if you yearn for traditional American style food and traditional service, Jerry's will fill the bill.

QEHO-UGKoyg_yhA928gtlg.text: Couldn't have picked a worse place in Phoenix. We got there a little after 7 on a Friday night. The all-you-can-eat fish special was sold out. The place was dead, definitely suspected bait and switch. My dad had the soup and salad. The salad looked old and the New England clam chowder was over cooked. My brother ordered the liver and onions (I know, liver and onions - but come on, our wives won't cook it for us). The liver appeared to resemble a shoe heal.... it was flat and way over cooked. I played it safe and got the country fried steak. It was ok. The side of lukewarm canned corn made me wonder when the food inspectors lasted conducted a temperature check.  Not sure how this place got 3.5 stars.... it must have been after last call.

jA3LITjLBtMCWdTy-iswfw.text: Love coming to this place at any time of the night! I'm originally from the south, and this hits the spot. I love their breakfast food, and the Hungry Traveler is where it's at. I heard they were going out of business soon, but hopefully with enough support they can stay afloat! Best diner in the neighborhood!

_iuvcoF4NhdZ-cyKwWurpg.text: The first thing I noticed was the charming atmosphere and the friendly staff. I was quickly tended to and food was provided promptly. The food was above average for a diner. The omelette was exceptional. The chicken fried steak was everything you'd want from a chicken fried steak.   4 stars because they have clocks indicating the time for the cities: Goodyear, Jerome, Phoenix, Globe, and Sun City. None of them indicate the same time. I'm not sure if this is some kind of sick joke or a lack of standards in regards to attention to detail...

PxD6h4aUlQ5Vs9wNgozwYw.text: I was surprised that I hadn't written a review for this place since I've been here a few times.  It's a really old school breakfast place.  You get that time warp feel when you're eating there.  The menu is huge and has some older classics if you want that.  I usually get the "breakfast sink" omelet which has quite a few things mixed in.  It's the classic omelet, hash browns, and toast thing.  It might not be the best breakfast you've ever had but it's good and the place has nice character.  Check it out sometime if you have the chance.

LGgnPgq6sxovgTvhRmRYvQ.text: Jerry's is a classic American style diner.  Don't come here looking for a vegan menu or to know the name of the chicken they fried.  Don't come here and ask for 2 pumps and soy milk.   The food is pretty good.  Breakfast is their strong suit.  It is inexpensive and the staff is friendly.   I have been here for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Try a cinnamon roll in the morning or enjoy a burger.  The sandwiches are nothing special and the coleslaw is bland.  They keep your drink full.  Give them a shot for breakfast.

m9TKjglU6qH7sPCZm41-oQ.text: If you are looking for Americana dining reminiscent of the 60s and 70s this is the place. The food is good and there are a lot of selections, breakfast, lunch and dinner. The Wait Staff is friendly and the service is good. The decorum nods slightly to the 50s, the place is clean with plenty of parking. There is a kid's menu. There are a couple of daily specials, my Daughter and I each chose Chicken & Waffles, an excellent Southern/Soul Food dish. One would generally order Kool-Aide with Chicken & Waffles but I got ice tea with a lemon wedge and my Daughter got coffee. I enjoyed my meal but I felt the chicken was too crispy, my Daughter loved hers. I've eaten here many times over the years and I think you will enjoy it

tK-WGKukTU4bAQ4bLVdR1A.text: Dennys-like.  Jerrys is great cause its next to embassy suites near dt phoenix.  The service is good with an old school 60s vibe and courteous staff. Expect a whole lotta small talk especially when its not so busy.  This place reminded me of the diner from pulp fiction for some reason.   Food is a major upgrade from dennys and related however the overall menu is somewhat similar.  I had dinner and breakfast here but the dinner was taken from the lunch menu and its just a sammich.   The bfast portions were generous. The flavors were whatever. Nothing salsa or ketchup couldnt remedy.  Pricing is similar to dennys too running $10-15 per head.  Will come back since its next to ho i stay at when visiting phoenix area.  And hours are 24/7.

07Q605cPHwfNxQEd0W8RCw.text: Where do I even start?? This should be a 1 star but our visit before tonight was good. Tonight a group came in and Wendy was our waitress. TRUST ME, if you come here and she's your waitress leave or move tables. Completely ridiculous. All our orders were messed up. Never got refills, finally got up and got our own. Another waitress stepped up and helped us. Brought my chips and salsa out. Salsa was in small plastic cup. Barely enough for 3 chips. The chips were terrible, burned and tough. She recommended the French dip. Bread was hard and meat tasted terrible. On a plus, we came here 2 nights ago and everything was great!! Try the chicken fried steak, been good by all who tried it. Also recommend hamburger steak. Wendy was rude when we kept telling her how everything was messed up. More people joined us from the Hotel and she kept complaining. To me, they would be happy to have more customers. Try at your own risk. One night it was great, tonight was worse possible ever!

GizLBG30cNemRCdKJKN7gw.text: I love this place. Excellent food, great prices and good service. We eat here regularly.

-XkSBm9lDF74aqedKQtv7A.text: GLAD I IGNORED THESE NEGATIVE REVIEWS!!! I've been on a little Diner Tour the past few weeks and I went to Jerry's for the first time this morning. I was hesitant due to some of these reviews but I will DEFINITELY be returning soon! Wait staff and management were more than attentive. Not one table was missed or left hangin' (I was at the counter and could see the whole restaurant). Not one plate sent back. My chicken fried steak was perfect! The gravy was thick, seasoned well and had sausage chunks throughout, unlike some of these places where you just get peppered wallpaper paste. My eggs were just fine. The toast came slightly over-buttered which I LOVED! I have zero complaints and believe me when I say I'm particular about my breakfasts. Ignore these complaints and find out for yourself! I'm looking forward to my next visit!

F7ush1iR6kPnh04EHb7B6Q.text: Old school diner but great friendly customer service.  Nothing super fancy just good o x ok comfort food conveniently located next to Embassy Suite.  Had chicken sandwich and seasoned fries which was pleasantly fresh.  I would visit again.

0B2FnESYTJH3QJ4rY0x4tg.text: I had the Chicken Fried steak with poached eggs and biscuit and gravy and it was still hot and so good!!  This is a very convenient place close to work and daycare!  Great breakfast with the hubby and love the old school decor!!

CDeG2M_1L0bNR-5Uu1n2jg.text: This restaurant is in my neighborhood, and I absolutely enjoy going to breakfast here. The staff are very friendly and the food is always delicious. Thanks Jerry's for being there!

rdC5IdQXNFX58rH8Y3tJLw.text: Been to Jerry's a bunch of times and all I can say is this place is great! The customer service is great! The food is always fresh and the place is clean. Server Kimberly is really friendly and personable. She goes out of her way to make sure customers are happy and having a good dining experience.
