i6Fi_DPsV3SmkqHTyVLoPA.text: This place is a classic diner with a very retro 60's vibe that  fits in well with all the nearby historic neighborhoods.  Prices are super reasonable considering the quantity and quality of food you get.  Service is relaxed and staff is always super friendly and cheerful to everyone.  It's a place where you feel free to pick up a section of the daily newspaper and enjoy your breakfast.  The menu is a mixture of tried-and-True roadside diner fare mixed in with some creative daily specials that are always worth a try.    My personal fave for breakfast are the Eggs Benedict..  Yeah, the Hollandaise sauce is probably from Sysco (does anyone really think any restaurant makes Hollandaise sauce from scratch anymore???)  -- but the eggs are poached perfectly and served up on a toasted English muffin topped with ham  and served with a very generous serving of home fries or hash-browns.      If you have a serious sweet tooth --  try the homemade cinnamon rolls.  These things are the size of a hubcap from a '55 Buick and yummy-yummy.  Or if you are in the mood for coffee and a great dessert -- try the homemade cakes. The cakes are always homemade from scratch and I've never had one that wasn't incredible. The Red Velvet cake is my best-est fave, followed by the carrot cake.

UE08jC4kZO_-xmQCrmADsQ.text: Okay, so can be a bit understaffed and I haven't tried most of the menu...  But, they have the best damn waffles I've ever had, anywhere in America!!!

gkmH6vG5W74MqrG0MUPNRg.text: Not terribly impressed. The atmosphere was a cute, slightly dated diner, which I like. I will say the bathrooms were nasty, which is never a good sign in a restaurant. The food was underpar. I could tell the eggs for the omelet were the fake ones, and the hash (if that's what you can call it) was stringy and mushy, I also felt like it tasted a little too old. The veggies seemed fresh, and the toast was okay. For $10 after tip I will probably never be back. If you like places like Denny's I would go as far as to say this is better than that, but with so many more options in this area I personally don't think it can compete. I would recommend The Acacia Cafe or Berthas up on Indian School.

RTa2kAKBUlO934IZ_mggzA.text: This place is where you SHOULD go instead of to Denny's or Village Inn.  The prices are great, and their food- whether breakfast or dinner is worthy.  Amazing meal, no, but if you've been out late, and don't want a ....burto's of any kind, go to Jerry's.  They are never super busy, but there are often groups of older regulars (which for me is fun to see!)  The decor is fun, not like a run down Denny's.  And the staff is VERY fast and very friendly...have even come to open the door for us before we made it to the curb!  This place is VERY close to us, so we will be returning often!  Easy for people to not know it exists...in a spot too close to the freeway, and not near anything else heavily visited...but worth checking out!!

5nROv8uznkbFQxykWSY5Mw.text: Excellent food at unbelievably low prices. This is a diner that seems to draw a crowd. And why not? I had the battered fish, which is fish and chips with a side of soup, veggies and cornbread. The fish was surprisingly good, as well as the soup. And all that for under $10. Sign me up for a return trip.

IY4KxQaha4SDyIjYjBVPfA.text: Had breakfast here.  It's pretty much your standard, run of the mill breakfast place... when you walk in it reminds me of a Denny's type of place.  The service was decent, not fantastic and the food was standard... better than Denny's though.  It was fresh and filled my belly.  Took a little flagging down to get more coffee but nothing that would stop me from coming again.  I LOVE my breakfast and this... well it did the trick.  Nothing was overly greasy... eggs cooked to perfection... but its pretty hard to mess up eggs and bacon.  If I were in this area I would consider this an option... again... not the best but it was decent.

xbHC87YM2nihdOyWkihbuw.text: We were staying next door at the Embassy Suites, and their restaurant was not open for dinner yet and I needed to eat early to make the Promise Keepers Conference.  Since it was Friday, they offered AYCE fish and chips.  Even though the only waitress was overwhelmed since there were almost 5000 men in town for the conference, she did her best and got us our meal.  The fish was fresh and light, not greasy and obviously hand breaded, large pieces too, and the fries were old school, loved them.  Been there since 1966.  Not the best meal I've had, but one of the best fish and chip dinner's I've had a diner.  Open 24 hours.  A bit nostalgic.

fuyyQyzv4esmNbR4CVEgbA.text: Love, love, love Jerry's!  My Mom, brother, and I have been coming here for awhile now, and it's always good!  They have great, fresh food at really good prices.  Service is always fast, and our waitresses are always sweethearts.  The food is delicious, and there's so much good stuff to choose from.  It's a nice clean restaurant with a good old fashioned vibe.  Thanks so much Jerry's, and all your wonderful staff!!

tL4qS3QqHvotPNllwHpEXg.text: The only reasons this place gets two stars are: The waitress - She was great The decor - Great retro styling - probably authentic since the place opened in 1966  * The so-called NY strip was thin as a pancake and riddled with gristle * The ribs were not fall off the bone... More like undercooked and tough * The vegetables are terrible - they taste exactly like the kind you get from a frozen bag * The fried chicken was apparently edible * The bathroom was dank and dark and felt like the kind of bathroom used by horror movies  Sorry Jerry's Restaurant but your food is terrible.  I will not be returning.

M-DlwDZ6KFoL26m6rcnP2w.text: Laura the best waitress in the valley is back at Jerry's she is there every night but Sunday and Monday. This place rocks again. The best late night place to go, great food, and with Laura back the best service around, as far as I am concerned every waitress in the world should go and watch her work you could definitely learn a few things.  If I were to open my own restaurant this women would be running the show. To the owners and management of Jerry's you better take care of this lady.

m6GyOVFYoFqm_m-GDK-y1Q.text: I love the food here and the staff is nice. The chicken fried steak with eggs is a great breakfast. Easy to get in and get out.

FLpiAgfsjZZZot4_DtCvFQ.text: Great service, great food, great price. I have been here twice now and if you like breakfast this is the best place I have found in my trip so far. I recommend this to everyone. Only reason it's not a five star is I haven't ate many other places yet here in AZ.

qTlkeTel0ehlYgJavXa_yQ.text: Seriously lack of bicycle rack.  Good breakfast.  Awesome waitresses!

V8vYRT1KjCBxhJqCtNcZdg.text: I love diners, I love a place where you have no idea what you want to eat, you go look at the menu and you settle on something that hits the spot. Before Jerry's my go to diner was 5 and Diner. Don't get me wrong I like 5 and Diner, but I love places that aren't Chains.  Jerry's is just a laid back diner, where I think after a few visits they learn your names and you become family. The waitress we usually get seems to remember us each time we go back.  I have ordered the Fried Chicken, which was top notch! So flavorful and crunchy. I loved that the first time we went they only had one more serving so my friend and I couldn't both get the fried chicken. I mean he was a little bent, but I got to eat the chicken. And the fact that it is so popular that you are "lucky" if you get to order it!  I have also been back for Friday Night Fish Fry. The Fish Fry is really good fish and probably the best  tartar sauce of any diner I have been too!  Don't forget the Cinnamon Roll with whipped butter...So sinfully delicious! I feel guilty eating it its almost too good!  This is definitely a place I will be frequenting! I might even get a booth that is my booth!

CJAj1N06ykXq_smDUTMO0Q.text: The food is usually pretty good, but it just depends on which of the cooks are preparing the food that day. I usually get the hungry traveler, which is 2 eggs, 3 sausage links, 3 slices of bacon, hash browns, and unlimited pancakes... For around $8. Sometimes it comes out good, sometimes it comes out not-so-good. The hash browns are typically great, nice and crispy. The last time I stopped by and got that same meal, my hash browns were a soggy mess; so I asked the waitress if I can have them cooked a little more crispy. She came back 10 minutes later with a new order of hash browns, that were a soggy mess. I said that I had asked for them a little more crispy, and she said "well that's how we cook them here". I know that's not True, I don't think that any restaurant at all would prefer to serve undercooked hash browns. But whatever, that server was probably just having a bad day. The pancakes are always great every time.

5ABUjOyUENCN8UOOQnyTTg.text: It's 4:00 am on a Friday, you've just finished listening to awesome music and drinking too much, you're starving and want some good comfort food to fill your gut and soak up that alcohol..... enter Jerry's.  The place was open.  The place was clean.  The food was good.  The service was great.  The prices were great.  WAY better than a Denny's, better than most diner's I've been to, actually.  I had ham and eggs and the plate was delicious.  The ham steak was gigantic, the eggs perfect, and hash browns were done just right... crispy and good.

0jFuobo1_HZi2Ffhat1A6w.text: The Jerry's on Thomas used to have good food but over the last few months something has changed.  If one meal were bad, I would go back, and I did but all three meals over the last few months have been kind of icky.  My last visit was on 5/5/2012 and I'll have to say that was my last meal at this Jerry's.

NG7Ik6MHywGILSun7IN0gA.text: If your in the mood for a no frills breakfast, Jerry's is your place.  The service is quick and friendly.  The food is just like mama used to make it.  I like the large windows that look out onto Thomas, good people watching while you wait for your meal.  The menu is basic diner food but let me point out the "Hungry Traveler" - eggs, hashbrowns, pancakes, your choice of bacon/ham/sausage and biscuts & gravy all for $8.  I prefer Jerry's to the typical bfast diner chains because the food is better, it's clean and I don't leave smelling like a grease ball.

2HO2rPSy-5iCLHwpfkM4GA.text: I'm not sure why but I am always hesitant to go to restaurants attached to hotels.  It could be from a bad experience in my childhood that I don't quite remember, but I think it's starting to go away.  The husband and I decided to come here because we are leaving for Washington for 6 weeks this weekend and we were on a mission to only try new places to eat our last weekend here.  We stopped by for breakfast on Saturday morning.  There were very few people in here, maybe 5 or 6 tables so we were immediately seated.  Our server was super nice in that cool-mom type of way.  She got our drinks quickly and refilled them often.  After a couple minutes perusing the menu and seeing lots of tasty things, I decided on the Rock and Roll Waffles, which is a thick waffle with bacon and eggs sitting on top of it.  Every time I order something like this, where there is supposed to be stuff on top of something else, they always serve it on the side.  Oh well.  The husband and I also decided to split a cinnamon roll as a pre-breakfast app.    The cinnamon roll was delicious.  It was sweet and gooey with just the right amount of cinnamon.  It was also one of those fabulously soft and chewy ones, not a crusty one.  It was especially delicious with a little bit of butter on it.  My waffle was also fantastic with a crispy outside and a surprisingly fluffy interior.  I didn't so much like the scrambled eggs, they were kind of flavorless, but I don't really like eggs anyway, so it doesn't matter.  The bacon was pretty good, nice and salty and a little bit thick.    I will definitely go back again in the future.  I loved the old school vibe going on with this place and I love that I get better food at a better price with better service than I would get at any Denny's or IHOP.

5b1r_Pa5HzRibAtHhHd4AA.text: LoLo's chicken and waffles were my first choice but the 45 minute wait at 10:30am wasn't good for me so went here.  Place is huge and the waitstaff friendly and quick.  Food is greasy diner fair, which I loved.  They had a great dessert display case.  Breakfast for two, under $20.

i0X9DGs5yvwquh1MNXuxDg.text: Came here alone at 1:30am on a Friday night and sat at the counter. I ordered a southwest turkey sandwich and fries. The sandwich was average, and the fries were perfect. The friendly chit-chat between the waiter and the regulars at the counter was amusing enough that I decided to hang out longer while enjoying a slice of hot apple pie topped with whipped cream. The service was excellent! I live close by, so hoping that Jerry's becomes my new late night food stop. Next time, I'll try the breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Jerry's Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southwest Turkey Sandwich and Fries! :)

sugKtV94hW9I_N89xIM8sw.text: This place has a split personality. I went here on Monday in the food and service were good and the environment was comfortable. I went back on Tuesday and the place was awful. Terrible service and almost as bad food (flavorless). I'm going to pretend that the Tuesday experience was just an off day.

cg_O0F1PkfoANqsOmpbB3w.text: This is our goto restaurant.  They have a great fish fry but get there early.  They tend to run out fast.

l8x9y1TQW3Po4Q4GS51KzQ.text: This post is more to the manager than about the restaurant. The servers have always been good to me and the food is typical diner food at a decent price. However, when you have a single server working the breakfast shift and 15 or more people unexpectedly show up, it's time for you to come out of the managers office and fill coffee, run the cash register, or serve food.  I saw you for 15 seconds walk by and then never saw you again. I have a feeling you would hold your server accountable for any complaints received during such a rush. When your people need help, it's your role to step up. There was no other place to post this, so I hope it makes it to your attention.

4SjdhINO0NSnUSgQD3XTFw.text: I use to like coming here but the last time we asked the waitress how long the wait is? she looked at us and gave us a glare and said I don't know. Never will return...

pePleEjpIKryg4SIv1Y-iw.text: Charles kicks ass. First time eating there (Denver omelet was delicious) and his attitude and service level is impeccable. Will definitely be coming back.

-XJ_olFQEJayMhgtd3FSvg.text: I loved my experience at Jerry's. I actually came in two different evenings on my trip to Phoenix. So nice I ate there twice! Their food was on point and the menu is very diverse. This is the kind of place that makes you want to call your grandparents and tell them you love them!

photos.caption: Photo of Jerry's Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nice set up! Last night I had the NY Strip special. All of this for 10ish$ - great food!!!
Photo of Jerry's Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Back of the menu!
Photo of Jerry's Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. front of menu!

2JHpwrETqR_cMHipad3aUA.text: Just a nice place to come and have a causal Saturday breakfast. Nothing fancy. Just good food. Comes out super hot, comes out fast, and you will always leave full. Jeremy has been our server three times and is always top notch. A great place to go if you want to quick breakfast for under $15. Try it you'll like it!

photos.caption: Photo of Jerry's Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Always enjoy spending time, how ever little with my pookie pie. Thanks Jer-Bear!

dYwi55ZBVC21AjjJRJppQQ.text: Ok... Been waiting for like 45 minutes for our food. Host is slow and not a helpful man at all. Older blonde server has a nasty ass chip on her shoulder and cant seem to smile at all. Now our server is busting his ass tryung to get everything done. Kudos to him. Management should be slapping themselves. Its snowbird season... HIRE MORE FRIGGNG STAFF FOF CHRIST SAKE. Food finally came out an hour after ordering. Eggs were super cold but everything was yummy as usual.

6SFie932r5wW_GJoyRqV1g.text: I ordered the hot turkey sandwich.  I should have asked exactly what kind of turkey they used (do they roast their own, turkey breast, etc.) It shows up and looks like the cook ran over to the market and picked up a package of Carl Buddig turkey, plopped it on some white bread and tossed some gravy on it.  I tried to eat it, but I could make that happen.  I called my server over and asked her for something else.  I ordered the ground sirloin plate. Basically the same thing as the turkey sandwich except there was a hamburger patty covered in gravy, mashed potatoes covered in gravy, a bowl of peas, salad and a piece of corn bread.  It was tolerable.    I suggested to the server that maybe they should get some real turkey and bump up the price a bit to make the plate a bit more appetizing.  As for the hamburger patty, could it kill them to have some ground beef in the fridge and make up a handmade patty instead of using a puny hamburger patty?  The place has some interesting food advertisements on the wall touting their excellent this and their fabulous that.  Perhaps Jerry should reevaluate what is being pushed on to the customers and perhaps the place would be a bit busier.  I'm wondering how breakfast is?

9jl_Gb5ZlzUMeiaceHBuGA.text: Great little diner with a nice big menu. Be sure to check the special board when you walk in. The hash browns are not traditional but they are still pretty good. I've had the Ruben a few times now and would recommend it. Breakfast is always great too.

exMMMZtCIDIKsvSUBysMOQ.text: Don't come here if your hungry. Ordered 30 minutes ago...no food in sight! Blahhhh  Once the food came it was a pretty good breakfast.

XWkhMTjjGsoLWRw_CtfNYQ.text: Had to just walk out of here. They had a big party in the back room, and couldn't be bothered to help anyone else.   We sat for 10 minutes before the server came to take our order. She didn't say hi, didn't say there would be a delay.   Waited 20 more before asking how much longer. She didn't know. The only cook wasn't talking to her. We got up and left. This was Saturday at dinner time. Lame!

3FAKiAqBOizVa0WyntqRmg.text: Went here yesterday around 6pm. A Mexican guy and myself could not get service or seated by the lady I thought was the hostess. She sat a white lady and her daughter who walked in before me, while the Mexican guy was already there. The lady NEVER came back to seat us. It took the guy waiting tables to seat the Mexican guy and take my to go order. I'll NEVER go back there... The only reason this place got a star is because I was forced to give it!

PxtWbJkz-FPw3TWy3jimxA.text: We have been here for breakfast on many occasions and have never had a bad meal. Recently we tried the all you can eat Friday fish fry and it is wonderful. The clam chowder is excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Jerry's Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turkey Dinner

dBu3FlXGOlj8q0rVRsLYVQ.text: The food here is good.  So far I've had....  Fried Chicken - Awesome, better than Lo-Lo's(yea, that's right, I said it)  Chicken Fried Steak - Nom Nom Nom  Corned Beef Hash - It's the canned stuff, which I love, but most will think it isn't foofy enough for them  Guacicalifornia Sandwich - Very good chicken sandwich, I was impressed.  This place also frys the French fries long enough so that you don't get any soggy ones.  I know that sounds stupid, but I can't stand places that can't get FF's right.  They have been a common side item for eternity, get it right.

wzHwVpimQbZnHcG8wTw3jg.text: This is a great place to go in the morning or late at night after partying.  I will forever enjoy going to this place because it reminds me of truck stop food while traveling.  The hungry traveller will always fill you up with bottomless pancakes but the country fried steak is also something I always get.  It gets 4 stars because sometimes they are understaffed and takes a bit to get service.  But when I go, I'm usually not in a hurry anyways.  The staff is always friendly day or night. Even a simple side salad is fresh and deserving of props.  The awesome thing is the fresh desserts and pie will satisfy any drunk or Sunday camper.  If you're tired of the usual IHOP or hole in the wall breakfast place, enjoy the old school diner atmosphere that th is place has to offer.

JHseOQPF360mYolbKFtzRQ.text: This is one of those old fashioned diners that does it right!  No fancy vegan goat cheese infused omelets or French Briocche toast....just old fashioned goodies.....biscuits and gravy, scrambled chorizo and eggs...good coffee and great service!

G8xhDy5XIr8fNUaQnCLJ8Q.text: Horrible. Delivery of grilled cheese sandwich, fish & chips, 4 biscuits, 4 pieces cornbread. Where to start? Food haphazardly slapped together: preformed fish, not proper filets, thinly breaded, not battered, tasteless, dry. Sandwich was two limp, half-raw small pieces of white bread (no choice), with a slice of processed stuff tossed in. Not even melted. Biscuits: only half my order arrived--were a few thin separated layers--flabby, flavorless and doughy-flat, tossed around in a styrofoam box. BISCUITS? Flaky, real biscuits? Hardly. Just a couple of cold tiny thin pancakes. 'Butter' was a bit of margarine, chips nothing to speak of. Cornbread dry, flavorless, sad. All of this for $40, plus PostMates' delivery company's charge of $10, which driver doesn't get, plus his $5--insane. Next morning, left message w/ server for manager 'Sheldon'. He didn't even bother to call back. Nice.

yijwopr0nX-lJOlBR5WTNA.text: This place has been there for as long as I can remember.  I can't ever remember eating  there as a kid. However; I went today. My husband ordered a California burger it had guacamole in it. He loved it. I ordered a pancake, cheese eggs, bacon,  sausage and hashbrowns. The hasbrowns were a little raw so they brought me out some that were well done.  The food was plentiful. We should've shared.   The waitress was very friendly and had nice suggestions.   I'm a fan. I will return not frequently but late night for sure.

xqNnKwVZ20cSB8XpT_QajA.text: I go to Jerry's every chance I get. I can't rave enough about their bacon! If I get an egg breakfast that comes with bacon, I order an extra side of bacon! I've been here at least 6-8 times in the last year! I've taken friends from the east coast here and they loved it too!  Finding a "diner" style place in Arizona is difficult, to say the least. I find the staff very friendly and helpful.  Again, it's all about the bacon!!

faX8njzlp8J3_oKpUtfIBg.text: Always good service..vintage feel..family friendly. Waffles and the burgers are the best on the menu. Food way better than the chains!

jhZs6yoMckxkhDnox-FYQw.text: Very unimpressed.  Came here for late night after drinking munchies... and got the nachos with chorizo.  HARDLY ANY CHEESE. The vanilla milk shake is bland... yup bland :( never again:(

AvJWzOTECdcv6UyYeP6cuw.text: My girlfriend and I came in here on a Sunday night and we're warmly welcomed by our future waitress.  I had the pork chops and she had the special which was the prime rib . Our service was good . Food was above average and the 2 of us paid under $27 for PRIME RIB and my pork chops! Definitely will be coming back . These little diners are a dying breed .

qtAU8R_CRROGeuC60hvohA.text: Jerry's restaurant has great service. Pamela our server was awesome. Great food and old fashion look. I love this place.

ckYQ5F7kOszwQVym-jlJyA.text: Great food and great service. Place was packed, but was still seated quickly and received fast and friendly service. Server Charles was very attentive and on top of things. It has been over 10 years since I was last at a Jerry's Restaurant. To say the least I was extremely impressed with today's experience. Keep up the great work!

NXNV2TL8Zucj8wSxgADq-g.text: We waited over a half hour for our food  food wasn't too good and the service was meh idk that I would go back actually I wouldn't go back nor would I recommend going to eat there

iqRY2qDGrZJb5apSZTWHTA.text: Plate was hotter than the tired meat loaf and mashed potato. The peas and carrots  were very over cooked mush. No comfort in this comfort food. The creamy chicken tortilla soup was great! My sons Charlie's mess was very disappointing. Soft chewy chips.  They lost our ticket so we waited a very long time for bad food.

E22zGyMaOWGBRsRnRuDoxw.text: Counter style diner that boasts being around since 1966. Little gem near downtown Phoenix offers a variety of choices and is very quick serving the food. My belgian waffles were tasty and done. My guest's egg benedicts were great also. Our wassiter was friendly and more than accommodating. Let's hope this city staple stays around a while!

Lg4xCN2gFZCNsRjZO43kmQ.text: If there was a neggative star review option that's where I would start. This was pretty much the worst dining experience ever. Our waitress was pleasant at the beginning and promptly brought my sons pancake. However 45 minutes later my 2year old was way over this and our food was nowhere in sight for mother and grandma. The waitress was highly defensive when grandma made a comment about order being lost. Was rude and adamant that it was the cooks fault not hers.... Then we get the food to go and my anticipated homemade chili turned out to be more like brown mush aka canned chili  gross food terrible service.

photos.caption: Photo of Jerry's Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chili? Or dog food? Blech!!!

xlhawBSI8rSEIewHJoYQNQ.text: First when asked what I'd like to drink by the waiter I asked for an orange juice but was brought a tea, he apologized and seemed sincere but then he said he'd be bring back extra napkins with our meal which never happened. I  wasn't crazy about the food at all either, would've been better off going to an IHOP or Denny's. A large fly also landed on my glass, my boyfriend attempted to shoo it away although the fly fell into my glass instead.  Yuck! Upon heading to pay I let the waiter know about the fly in my drink and he once again apologized and said "I know you guys come in pretty frequently, like once a week so I've got you next time." Not True; This was only our second visit and last.  Shows me the sincerity was not actually sincere at all.

diD7oFsaYm1BuvKq65bpGQ.text: Sometimes you just want average food, average prices without pressure of desert. This is the place for it.

FwSTwPZ-J5tDkfnFHRLboA.text: Got into town close to 10 pm on Thanksgiving day.  Had nearly given up hope on eating anything that night.  Glad they were open and nice to us.

gNgcFMZfwbiesfN9DJEfhw.text: I hated this place! Okay my boyfriend and I stopped here on Easter because everywhere else we tried was packed even though it was still early in the morning. When we walked in we were sat right away and asked what we wanted to drink. Not a second after the lady leaves with our drink order, another waitress come up and asked the same thing. So we tell her we have already ordered drinks, and she proceeds to ask us what we wanted to order. I mean during all of this it was less than five minutes, so of course we needed time to look over the menu.  The menu had a minimal number of food offerings BUT they had multiple variations. I guess they have the ability to scramble eggs 50 plus ways, because the menus was just a rundown of what consisted on the prior page of the menu. My boyfriend ordered a omelet that came with a side of toast, and I just ordered French fries. At this point I didn't want to be there. The waitress asked me multiple times if I just wanted fries as if I had to order more.  So the food comes out and it looks as if it were cooked in dirty grease, I've never seen an omelet so brown. My fries were definitely out of one of those frozen bags and the portion size was a bit pitiful. Here's the WORST part of all. When the waitress brought the food, she brought the check! That felt as if she wanted us to hurry and leave. Although it was rude in my opinion, I ate hurriedly because I was in a horrible mood and wanted to get out of this strange place fast!  With the food offerings, the actual food, the customer service and the environment...I will never visit this place again.

N-OGRpwAetPO5__1DoqatQ.text: What can I say about Jerry's? It's really more like what can't I say about Jerry's.  I love the atmosphere! I'm from Indiana, and it reminds me of a good ol' southern home style restaurant back in Indy. I always sit at the counter and love to watch the waiters get everyone's order. Man, they work so hard, and they are so polite. Customer service is top notch here!  We always end up here for breakfast. I get the meal that comes with biscuits and gravy, two eggs, bacon or sausage, and an optional side of hash browns. It's really good! Everything else they serve looks good too. I like to food watch. LOL I'm gonna have to try the French toast next time.  And there WILL be a next time and a next and a next . . .

photos.caption: Photo of Jerry's Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast of champs!! :))

38ZfJvkYj7_Oe3PoSeNvCA.text: Excellent accidental find.  We happen to be at a conference next door and when we got out we figured what the heck and we were hungry. What a pleasant find. From the moment we walked through the door we felt as if we had gone back in time to the old diner days when we got real homemade cooking. I have a real weakness for Chicken fried steak and this was some of the best I have had with fresh mashed potatoes and gravy. Came with corn and I ordered some corn bread to to top it off.  Corn bread was ok but processed.  Everything was fresh and delicious. So I had a quick thought that an old time diner might have a good milkshake. So I ordered and she said it would take about 10 minutes to prepare. It was fresh and delicious like we used to get. Everyone at the table took a taste and loved it.  Everyone was great done to the table buser. He was fun and attentive. I wanted to call our server 'Flo or Madge' and unfortunately forgot her name. On the way out I looked back into the kitchen and there was one cook working there so was surprised the service was so fast. I could not resist so waited until he looked out and gave him a thumbs up!   If you find yourself in the Thomas and 24th at area and want a good, fresh old time meal give this place a try. Skip the drive through and sit down for a real meal. We loved it and will be back.

-7NGGY941SW3TjLeTOBdag.text: If you're reading this on your mobile device, this review boils down to this:  If I lived nearby, I would eat here once a week.  I was staying at the hotel next door and after having mexican food for the past three days, I was looking for some comfort food.  I found the reviews on Yelp and seeing they served breakfast 24-7, I decided to walk on over.  I stopped in around 6:30 on a weekday evening and the place was pretty empty.  I was seated at a booth and was immediately greeted by my server.  Think Vera from "Mel's Diner."  She was terrific.  One of the specials was a bowl of green chili with rice or beans for $9.99.  I am a sucker for green chili whenever I'm out west.  I explained to Vera that I wanted to eat a bunch and if I was eating pancakes, I didn't have room for rice or beans.  She said it would be no problem just to get the chili by itself.  To go with the chili, I ordered pancakes and sausage, as well as an order of hash browns.  If there was a downside to my visit, it was that service was slow.  Like "we fresh cut the potatoes for your hash browns" slow.  Which was not a big deal to me because I had nowhere to be, but would have been a problem if I had been in a hurry.  The chili was great.  It had beef in it and I loved it.  The pancakes were terrific.  The sausage was familiar and average.  The hash browns were okay, but would have been better if they had been well done.  Next time, I'll ask for them that way.  For desert, I grabbed a slice of banana bread CAKE to go.  Yes you read that right, banana bread CAKE.  It was great.  All their cakes are homemade and they also had lemon, chocolate, and strawberry cake.  They also served pies, but they weren't made in-house, so I passed.  All in all, a great diner that I'd be happy to stop by the next time I'm in the area!!

o6bLWTI4Wywa7GCVTf4_hw.text: It used to be very good. My family used to frequent the place and now, not so much. I hate to do this because whoever checks these reviews from Jerry's, probably know who I am (tells you how much my family used to eat there lol). I usually just order chicken tenders and fries, but they've even screwed up on that. Sometimes, I don't eat them because the first taste they are cold, so much so I thought it was undercooked (it wasn't, but its appalling). Then some other family members have complained that there food just tastes bad. Not sure what's happened to Jerry's, but I hope they can fix it.

prSyt2HCHyMWKahvQ5SBnw.text: Looking at the place from the outside, I was at least hoping for a bit more than Denny's, but I'd,give Denny's five stars compared,to this place.  Took 15 minutes to get seated despite obviously open and clean booths. 19 minutes to get waters and another 15 for the waitress to take our orders.  At least a nice meal is worth waiting for, but the food was mediocre at best. Place was probably understaffed, but the waitress barely said a word.  Would recommend Carl's Jr. right up the street over this dump.

C3MZuveXKQYu9Q9ewNOcvQ.text: This is a nice little diner and is open 24/7. The wait staff is really nice even on graveyard and the pancakes are delicious! I also had an omelette but make sure you ask for extra cheese! The prices are very affordable as well.
